question: When will tickets be released?
answer: Tickets for HackBeanpot 2019 will be released mid-January via Eventbrite. Join our mailing list and we'll let you know when!

question: I don't have a lot of programming experience. Are hackathons for me?
answer: Yes! People of all levels of experience attend HackBeanpot. If you get stuck, we have mentors to provide assistance. We care much more about fostering a fun environment where you can learn rather than an environment that only attracts elite hackers. Our blog advice for first-time hackers can be found here and here.

question: I am a student from ____. Is this hackathon open to students from my school?
answer: Yes! HackBeanpot is open to anyone who is at least 16 years old. If you will be under 18 at the start of the event, please contact team@hackbeanpot.com to fill out extra paperwork before the event.

question: Do you provide travel reimbursements?
answer: Unfortunately, we are not able to provide travel reimbursements.

question: Are there limits on team size?
answer: No limits! However because prizes are budgeted for teams of 5 and under, we recommend max 5 members per team.

question: Should I bring my resume?
answer: If you want to, sure! You can also upload your resume here and we'll pass it along to sponsoring companies.

question: Can I work on an old project?
answer: Working on an existing project is ok, but you won't be eligible for prizes.

question: What should I bring?
answer: HackBeanpot is an overnight hackathon, so we recommend bringing a laptop, charger, phone, toothbrush, and anything else you'd normally bring to an overnight event. We also wrote a blog post about what to bring (link).

question: I have a dietary restriction. Will there be food for me?
answer: Yes! Just make a note about your dietary restriction on the registration form; we'll make sure you're covered.
